meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let me tell you, I just wrapped up playing Chants of Sennaar, and oh boy, my linguistic skills got a major workout!

First off, let's get the formalities out of the way. I've read through the reviews from Slant Magazine, Worth Playing, SpazioGames, God is a Geek, Hardcore Gamer, TheSixthAxis, and Noisy Pixel. While they all seem to agree that Chants of Sennaar is a unique puzzle game with an interesting concept, my review's gonna be different – it's gonna be FUN!

So, let me ask you, have you ever tried to decipher ancient languages while sneaking past mystical creatures? No? Just me? Okay, moving on! In all seriousness, Chants of Sennaar does a fantastic job of making you feel like a linguistic detective, unraveling the mysteries of forgotten cultures. It's like solving a giant puzzle, and I'm not just whistling Dixie!

Now, I know what you're thinking – "Isn't this game just a bunch of puzzles with fancy language?" Well, yes and no. While the core gameplay is centered around deciphering ancient scripts, there's more to it than that. You see, Chants of Sennaar has this lovely way of weaving together mythology, cultural anthropology, and, of course, language skills. It's a triple threat!

But let me tell you, as much as I adore solving puzzles, even I got frustrated at times (okay, maybe more often). The stealth mechanics can be a bit wonky, and those darned mystical creatures will make you restart more than once... or twice... or three times. However, the generous checkpoint system means you'll never feel too far behind.

In the end, Chants of Sennaar is a game that's hard to put down. It's an adventure that will challenge your linguistic skills and leave you feeling like a genius (even if I'm biased). And who knows? You might just learn something along the way!

So, there you have it – my review of Chants of Sennaar. If you're a fan of puzzle games, language, or just want to try something new, this game's definitely worth checking out!
